intro: Corydalis portenieri, commonly known as the Sierra Madre corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. Its leaves are narrowly elliptical and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are usually unbranched. Corydalis portenieri is a perennial herb that blooms in spring and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
